item.title: 耐克股价下跌，原因是预测撤销令投资者担心扭亏为盈的时间表
item.description: 耐克股价在周三的盘前交易中下跌了约 6%，此前该公司撤回了年度营收目标，这让投资者对这家运动服装巨头在新任首席执行官埃利奥特-希尔（Elliott Hill）领导下实现扭亏为盈的时间表充满了猜测。【原文：Nike shares dropped about 6% in premarket trading on Wednesday after the company withdrew its annual revenue target, keeping investors guessing on the timeline for a turnaround at the sportswear giant under incoming CEO Elliott Hill.】

item.title: 欧佩克+将在小组会议上维持产量政策不变
item.description: 两位消息人士告诉路透社，定于周三召开的欧佩克+部长级小组会议不太可能建议对政策进行任何修改，从而允许该集团从12月开始逐步增产。【原文：An OPEC+ ministerial panel scheduled to meet on Wednesday is unlikely to recommend any changes to policy, allowing the group to start gradually increasing production from December, two sources from told Reuters.】

item.title: 受美联储降息和人工智能乐观情绪影响，9 月科技市场价值飙升
item.description: 美联储降息通常会提高高增长公司的未来利润和现金流，受此提振，许多科技公司的市值在 9 月份飙升，对人工智能的持续热情也进一步推动了市值的增长。【原文：The market capitalization of many tech firms surged in September, buoyed by a Federal Reserve rate cut that typically enhances future profits and cash flows for high-growth companies, and further fuelled by continued enthusiasm for artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势加剧，期货下跌；就业数据即将公布
item.description: 美国股指期货周三下滑，原因是中东地缘政治紧张局势和国内港口罢工事件使投资者在预计将揭示经济健康状况和货币政策轨迹的数据公布前保持紧张。【原文：U.S. stock index futures slipped on Wednesday as geopolitical tensions in the Middle East and a domestic port strike kept investors on edge ahead of data expected to shed light on the health of the economy and the monetary policy trajectory.】

item.title: 欧盟要求 YouTube、Snapchat 和 TikTok 提供有关推荐的信息
item.description: 欧盟委员会周三要求 YouTube、Snapchat 和 TikTok 提供信息，说明其算法向用户推荐内容时所使用的参数，以及它们在放大一些系统性风险方面所起的作用，包括与选举程序、心理健康和未成年人保护有关的风险。【原文：The EU Commission requested on Wednesday information from YouTube, Snapchat and TikTok on the parameters used by their algorithms to recommend content to users and their role in amplifying some systemic risks, including those related to the electoral process, mental health and protection of minors.】

item.title: 巴西数字银行 PicPay 计划 2025 年在纳斯达克上市
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士告诉路透社，巴西数字银行 PicPay 将开始招聘金融公司，计划明年在纽约进行首次公开募股。【原文：Brazilian digital bank PicPay will start hiring financial firms to carry out a planned initial primary offering in New York next year, two people familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 尽管业务中断，马士基仍继续停靠贝鲁特港口
item.description: 集装箱航运公司马士基周三表示，尽管黎巴嫩的安全局势不断恶化，但该公司继续为黎巴嫩客户提供服务，每周在贝鲁特停靠两次。【原文：Container shipping company Maersk said on Wednesday it continued to serve its customers in Lebanon with two weekly callings in Beirut despite the deteriorating security situation in the country.】

item.title: 元、澳大利亚银行吹嘘在取缔 "名人诱饵 "诈骗广告方面取得的进展
item.description: Meta 表示，作为与澳大利亚银行合作遏制 "名人诱饵 "欺诈行为的新努力的一部分，它已从 Facebook 和 Instagram 上撤下约 8,000 个所谓的 "名人诱饵 "欺诈广告。【原文：Meta said it has taken down some 8,000 so-called "celeb bait" scam ads from Facebook and Instagram as part of a new effort with Australian banks to curb the practice.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车九月份销量增长 1% - 沃尔沃
item.description: 总部位于瑞典的沃尔沃汽车公司周三表示，该公司 9 月份的汽车销量同比增长 1%，达到 62,458 辆。【原文：Volvo Cars' sales rose 1% year-on-year in September to 62,458 cars, the Sweden-based automaker said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日本央行债券购买狂潮给日本期货市场带来负面影响
item.description: 日本 9 万亿美元的债券市场正在为混乱做准备，因为央行大量买入债券造成的纸张短缺预计将冲击投资者和承销国家债务销售的交易商所使用的衍生品结算。【原文：Japan's $9 trillion bond market is bracing for disruption as a shortage of paper caused by the central bank's massive buying is expected to hit the settlement of derivatives used by investors and the dealers who underwrite the nation's debt sales.】

item.title: 码头工人罢工进入第二天，白宫站在工会一边
item.description: 美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）的政府向美国港口雇主施加压力，要求他们提高报价，以确保与码头工人达成劳资协议。【原文：President Joe Biden’s administration heaped pressure on U.S. port employers to raise their offer to secure a labor deal with dockworkers on strike for a second day on Wednesday, choking half the country’s ocean shipping.】

item.title: 国际能源署称，氢能项目投资正在加速，但不确定性依然存在
item.description: 国际能源机构（IEA）周三在一份报告中称，过去12个月中，氢能项目的最终投资决定增加了一倍，其中以中国为主，但由于该行业面临不确定性，装机容量和需求都很低。【原文：Final investment decisions for hydrogen projects have doubled over the last 12 months, dominated by China, but installed capacity and demand are low as the industry faces uncertainty, the International Energy Agency (IEA) said in a report on Wednesday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚最高法院驳回澳新银行就配股案提起的上诉
item.description: 澳大利亚企业监管机构周三表示，联邦法院驳回了澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）对一项诉讼提出的上诉，该诉讼认定澳新银行集团未披露价值 25 亿澳元（17.3 亿美元）的配股计划。【原文：Australia's corporate regulator said on Wednesday the federal court dismissed an appeal by ANZ Group against a lawsuit that found the lender guilty of not revealing about a share placement worth A$2.5 billion ($1.73 billion).】

item.title: 亚洲股市下滑，石油涨势因中东风险而扩大
item.description: 伊朗对以色列的弹道导弹袭击引发了对更广泛地区冲突的担忧，周三亚洲股市追随华尔街的抛售潮下挫，而原油则因供应中断的风险而走高。【原文：Asia stocks sank on Wednesday, catching up with the sell-off on Wall Street after Iran's ballistic missile strike on Israel provoked fears of a wider regional conflict, while crude oil pushed higher on the risk of supply disruptions.】

item.title: 韩国采购经理人指数（PMI）显示：海外需求疲软，韩国工厂活动大幅萎缩
item.description: 周三的一项民间调查显示，由于海外需求在今年首次放缓，韩国 9 月份的工厂活动出现了 15 个月来最大幅度的萎缩，这表明经济全面复苏的道路还很缓慢。【原文：South Korea's factory activity contracted at the sharpest pace in 15 months in September as overseas demand slowed for the first time in the year, a private survey showed on Wednesday, suggesting a slow road to a full-blown economic recovery.】

item.title: 中东战事扩大，美元坚挺
item.description: 由于投资者担心中东冲突扩大，伊朗对以色列的导弹袭击推动了安全资产的买盘，美元周三创下一周来最大涨幅。【原文：The dollar held its sharpest gain in a week on Wednesday after an Iranian missile attack on Israel drove buying of safe assets as investors fretted about the widening of conflict in the Middle East.】

item.title: 韩国通胀降温超预期，降息呼声渐高
item.description: 韩国 9 月份消费者通胀率降温幅度超过预期，自 2021 年初以来首次低于央行的目标值，市场对韩国即将放松政策的预期日益增强。【原文：South Korea's consumer inflation cooled more than forecast in September and below the central bank's target for the first time since early 2021, amid growing expectations of an imminent policy easing.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势升级，油价上涨超过 1 美元
item.description: 由于担心伊朗向以色列发射弹道导弹后中东地区石油供应中断，美国西德克萨斯中质原油（WTI）期货在格林尼治标准时间 2254 时上涨 1.09 美元，或 1.56%，至每桶 70.92 美元。【原文：U.S. West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude futures rose by $1.09, or 1.56%, to $70.92 per barrel at 2254 GMT on fears of oil supply disruptions in the Middle East after Iran fired ballistic missiles at Israel.】

item.title: 美国财政部官员称国际货币基金组织对华政策和融资保证 "过于客气
item.description: 一位美国财政部高级官员周二表示，国际货币基金组织在批评中国经济政策时 "过于客气"，应该更全面地披露中国和其他一些国家为支持国际货币基金组织贷款项目而提供的融资保证。【原文：The International Monetary Fund is "too polite" when it comes to criticizing China's economic policies and should more fully disclose financing assurances given by China and some other countries to support IMF loan programs, a senior U.S. Treasury official said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 伊朗导弹袭击后航空公司紧急转移航班
item.description: 伊朗周二向以色列发射了一连串弹道导弹，以色列的邻国关闭了领空，航空公司的机组人员绕开了不断升级的冲突，许多人寻求改道。【原文：Israel's neighbours closed airspace and airline crews skirted an escalating conflict, with many seeking diversions, after Iran fired a salvo of ballistic missiles at Israel on Tuesday.】

item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，凯雷支持的标准航空（StandardAero）IPO定价高于区间，将筹资 14.4 亿美元
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周二表示，美国飞机维修服务提供商标准航空（StandardAero）在美国的首次公开募股定价高于预期范围，募集资金14.4亿美元。【原文：StandardAero, a U.S. aircraft maintenance services provider, priced its U.S. initial public offering above its indicated range to raise $1.44 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 标准普尔将以色列评级下调至 "A "级
item.description: 本周二，S&P 将以色列的长期评级从 "A+"下调至 "A"，理由是近期以色列与真主党的冲突升级，安全风险增加。【原文：S&P downgraded Israel's long-term ratings to 'A' from 'A+' on Tuesday, citing heightened security risks given the recent escalation of the country's conflict with Hezbollah.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势升级吓坏投资者
item.description: 中东紧张局势的升级打击了投资者的信心，并引发了对风险较高资产（包括估值很高的美国股市）在局势恶化时如何应对的担忧。【原文：Escalating tensions in the Middle East have dampened investor confidence and raised concerns about how riskier assets, including the highly valued U.S. stock market, might respond if the situation worsens.】

item.title: 波音公司罢工工会在工人医疗保险被削减后向首席执行官发出呼吁
item.description: 波音公司最大的工会周二敦促该公司新任首席执行官凯利-奥特伯格（Kelly Ortberg）更多地参与解决美国西海岸约 33,000 名工人的罢工问题，因为他们的医疗福利被削减了。【原文：Boeing's largest union on Tuesday urged the planemaker's new CEO Kelly Ortberg to get more involved in resolving a strike by around 33,000 U.S. West Coast workers, after their healthcare benefits were cut.】

item.title: 中国需求疲软，耐克季度销售额降幅超预期
item.description: 耐克公司周二公布的第一季度营收降幅超过预期，这家运动服装巨头正在与主要市场中国的疲软需求作斗争，并面临来自全球新兴品牌的激烈竞争。【原文：Nike posted a bigger-than-expected drop in first-quarter revenue on Tuesday, as the sportswear giant battles weak demand in key market China and faces stiff competition from newer brands globally.】

item.title: 摩根大通高管称美国反电子政务集团的反弹言过其实
item.description: 摩根大通的一位高管周二表示，美国对环境、社会和治理（ESG）相关问题的政治反弹影响被夸大了，而且对美国蓬勃发展的绿色经济影响甚微。【原文：The impact of a political backlash against environmental, social and governance-related (ESG) issues in the United States is overstated and having little bearing on the country's burgeoning green economy, a JPMorgan executive said on Tuesday.】
